I honestly feel like the cooldown reset on Ultimate kills was a terrible idea. If Lux can kill someone with her full combo, then she's fulfilled her job. The main weakness of Lux is having 30 seconds of downtime on killing anyone if her full combo can't burst the adc/mage. Otherwise, she just stands there trying to throw out q's and e's hoping that does something (normally, they don't).
Instead, they should make her passive reduce her ultimate cooldown each time she procs it - it would work as a risk/reward mechanic. They want Lux to be more interactive, so she'll have to put in more work and be a little more vulnerable if she wants to lower the cooldown on her ult.
It also means rewarding good {{champion:99}}s with an ultimate cooldown reduction if she lands a full 5-man e>r combo. Which, against a competent team, is incredibly unlikely.

> Buffing her ult was fucking nonsense and only makes the game more snowbally.

Buffing her ult means she's less likely to use it for waveclear, historically one of the biggest complaints about Lux. It also was intended to help give that nudge for Lux to be used in higher elo more often since a good Lux will have more success while a bad Lux is more or less unaffected.

There are many other horrible snowballing champions when they're ahead (Ahri, Syndra, LB, Kat, etc.). 

Though I do somewhat of agree of irrelevant Lux's buff; if she already killed someone the favor of the teamfight already went to Lux's team, not making much of a difference anyway.

Well that's an interesting way to get to diamond.

She's one of very few champions capable of missing literally everything (or being dodged).  She's not mechanically difficult, but you really need to have good aim/prediction to reliably get kills.  You then need great positioning if you want to devastate teamfights (landing your ult on everyone requires you to position so they're roughly in a line, and they have to not notice you doing that).

Sure she can be picked up easily, but she still has plenty of room for growth.

Positioning is essential for literally every role, unless you're a tank. Things like Orianna ult and Blitz Q pretty much require the same exact thing. The only difference between {{champion:99}} and {{champion:61}} is that Orianna ult is much more devastating, due to it being an AoE CC that also deals a ton of damage (combined with your W), and that it requires the enemy team to be just generally clumped up and not just roughly in a line.

I can still see where you are coming from, as Lux's Q is a fairly slow skillshot that can be dodged. Granted, the hitbox is kind of stupid, but I digress. Orianna ult can also be hard to land if you can't find the right time to do it, which could potentially win (or lose) you the game.
